intro: Hieraciodes hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's hieracium, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. It has finely divided, grass-like leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
